Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign A 3723-B and S 3963-B, which would eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the current cap contained in the State Real Property Tax Law on State aid to the City for maintaining a system of improved real property tax administration (A.3723-B/S.3963-B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide a procedure for the granting of an exemption from real property taxes to eligible property acquired by not-for-profit institutions from the date they take ownership of the real property.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Provide a procedure for the granting of an exemption from real property taxes to eligible property acquired by not-for-profit institutions from the date they take ownership of the real property.
